summary:
Using the Atronach Forge improves Conjuration.

Using the Imbuing Chamber improves Enchanting.

Compatible with Dragonborn and Fall of the Space Core, Vol. 1 but not reliant on either.
descriptionHtml:
Do you like smithing?  Do you like summoning [b]unspeakable[/b] horrors into our plane of existence?

If the answer to both of these questions is yes, you may be interested in our newly improved [s]Atronach Forge[/s] [b]SMITHY OF HELLSPAWN (TM)[/b], now with Conjuration XP!  Going down to the Midden has never been more purposeful!

Now, I know what you\'re thinking:

But <mod author>, I am a Spheriphem interested in space and mastering the arcane arts in space.  Is the Smithy of Hellspawn [b]space-compatible[/b]?

To which I reply:

You spherical scamp, Smithy of Hellspawn (TM) is not only space-compatible but it\'s also [b]space-optional[/b]!  Space only knows why we included this feature!  (Greed, mainly.)

Still on the fence?  Let me sweeten the pot.

Act now and you\'ll also receive an enchanted Imbuing Chamber [b]absolutely free[/b] of charge!  This [b]wondrous[/b] device allows you to earn Enchanting XP and control people\'s minds WITH SPIDERS!

No Dragonborn?  NO PROBLEM!

We accept all subscribers, even those who do not wish to be [s]cool[/s] [s]hip[/s] the [b]LORD OF ALL SPIDERS[/b].  You will simply not be able to chuck spiders at people\'s heads.  (Poor you!)

But <mod author>, how are the things you say possible?

[b]BLACK @#$%ING MAGIC[/b]!  ...eh but seriously, we just stick a guy in front of a computer screen and he writes on a piece of papyrus or something.

[i]Boiler-plate Disclaimer: Smithy of Hellspawn (TM) is not to be confused with inXile\'s Hunted: The Demon\'s Forge.  Smithy of Hellspawn is actually an Atronach forge (with Conjuration XP).

Making use of our enchanted Imbuing Chamber is much like making use of a non-enchanted Imbuing Chamber, except that it is [b]1000x[/b] better!

No Space Cores were harmed in the making of this product.  Solstheim residency not required (but it helps!)  Download where exhibited.[/i]
author: Kain-Xavier
